title.narrative: Essential and lifesaving Sexual and Reproductive Health (SRH), and Gender-based Violence (GBV) Services to women and girls affected by insecurity in Palma District of Cabo Delgado, Mozambique.

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide essential and life-saving SRH and GBV response services to the vulnerable community, especially women and girls of Cabo Delgado. UNFPA and partners will procure and distribute reproductive health kits benefitting 20,516 women and girls, reach 3,660 persons with psychosocial support services, and provide dignity kits to 500 women and girls. The project offers life-saving assistance for 29,569 people, including 17,652 women, 1,356 men, 10,561 children, and 1,700 people with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS MOZAMBIQUE RAPID RESPONSE DISPLACEMENT 2021

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Communities are informed and aware of GBV, Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (SEA), women’s right and available services
Number of GBV prevention, mitigation and response information related IEC material produced and distributed
Number of community members reached with behavioural change messages on GBV, SEA, available services and women’s rights.
Displaced and vulnerable women and girls in host communities in the priority Districts have immediate access to essential and life-saving sexual, reproductive, maternal and newborn health services
Number of emergencies SRH tents set up and equipped (medical equipment and furniture) in IDP sites and host communities for provision of emergency lifesaving SRH and maternal health services
Number of health workers who have received Infection Prevention and Control masks and gloves.

RH.1 Number of live births assisted by a skilled health personnel (Number of deliveries (including with obstetric complications) conducted in Health Facilities that have been supported with Reproductive Health Kits.(Based on MISP calculator, with a target population of 50,000)
SP.2b Number of people benefiting from services enabled by inter-agency emergency reproductive health kits (in health facilities supported by UNFPA)
GBV survivors and vulnerable women and girls have been reached by essential GBV response services
H.9 Number of people provided with mental health and pyscho-social support services (disaggregated by sex and age)
Number of women and girls at risk of GBV and who are GBV survivors who have been reached with psychosocial support and GBV case management provided in the women and girls safe spaces.
PS.1b Number of safe spaces and/or centres constructed or rehabilitated (women and girls’ safe spaces (WGSS)
SP.1b Number of people benefiting from menstrual hygiene management kits and/or dignity kits
